pageProps.title: English upper-intermediate notes
pageProps.content:
Here are my notes from an English course I am going through. Each header is a separate topic.


### Work at startup
- get settled in - adapt to
- catch on - understand
- I was feeling - long but finished action
- I really wasn't expecting
- join in on
- get them up and running
- give them some direction on
- I'm going to ask you to
- leave a company (not quit)
- they used a strange vocabulary (not words)
- hold your hand


### Studying at university
- get expelled
- get suspneded
- kicked out of (school, etc)
- keep off (the streets, etc)
- deception
- integrity
- breakdown
- be together (she seems so together)
- I didn't mean to pry
- he has problems waking up
- if I didn't sleep well


### Traumas from the past
- snap out of it
- let yourself go
- burn the candle at both ends
- screw someone over
- be out of it


### Facing fears
- take a step
- last resort
- stay the course
- open up
- pull yourself out of a rut
- confront something head-on


### The most boring place
- urban decay
- newsworthy
- hot tip
- scoop
- dramatic landscape
- my wife and me ... (in this order)
- me and my friends ... (in this order)


### Dancing mania
- famine
- urge
- craze
- get caught up in something
- can't help yourself
- luckily no one was hurt
- my car spun around into the opposite direction


### Life choices
- get back at her
- don't get caught up
- I'll take your offer into consideration
- be a little calmer
- counselor
- there's got to be something we can do about it
- that's not what I meant
- I never thought of that


### A word in my ear
- get on with someone
- pitch in
- build up
- pass on
- go according to plan
- turn down
- give advice to junior specialists


### A letter to my younger self
- yobbo
- start from scratch
- stick to your guns
- scare the life out of me
- trust your instinct
- build up a good life-work balance
- make a rash decision
- throw yourself in
- block that doubt
- get to grips
- hands on
- end up with
- hangover
- find out about
- get somebody up to speed
- come on


### Miscellaneous
- break a leg
- couch potato


### Related notes
- [English →](/notes/English)
